Article Title: Bengal governor asks CM Mamata Banerjee to act on Sandeshkhali post-poll violence
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Bengal governor CV Ananda Bose on Sunday asked CM Mamata Banerjee to submit an immediate report on post-poll violence that has erupted in Sandeshkhali ."I am a bit worried about the situation in Sandeshkhali. From the inputs I have received, I have come to know about incidents of attacks on the women of Sandeshkhali within hours after the polling was over yesterday. I have written to the Chief Minister about the steps taken in this regard," Bose said while speaking to PTI."If such attacks continue and the inhabitants are tortured, I will open the doors of the Raj Bhavan for them to come and stay here. They will be provided safe shelter here," he added.Sandehkhali, already troubled by unrest , experienced another round of clashes between women and the police on Sunday, within a day after the election's conclusion.The confrontation occurred when law enforcement personnel arrived in the area and apprehended an individual in relation to previous attacks on policemen.In Agarhati village in Sandeshkhali, local women engaged in a physical scuffle with the Rapid Action Force (RAF) personnel, cut down tree trunks, and obstructed roads as the police searched for several individuals accused of assaulting them the previous night, according to a senior police officer."We have not arrested anyone, but local women have started protesting. Some of our female colleagues are injured. We are trying to talk to them and remove the barricades from the roads," the officer in Basirhat Police District said.The local women attempted to forcibly free the detained person, but their efforts were thwarted, the officer added."We are trying to bring the situation under control. A huge number of RAF, Quick Response Team (QRT) and policemen are present here," the officer said.Sandeshkhali, a riverine delta adjacent to the Sundarbans, has been in a state of unrest since January 5. On that day, a team from the Enforcement Directorate (ED) was attacked while conducting a raid on the premises of TMC strongman Shajahan Sheikh in connection with an alleged ration scam.On February 29, the West Bengal Police arrested Sheikh and his accomplices for their involvement in the attack on the ED officers. Following the assault by a mob of approximately 1,000 people, which left three ED officials injured, a deputy director of the agency filed a complaint with the superintendent of police in Basirhat.(With inputs from agencies)
Article Summary: Bengal governor CV Ananda Bose asked CM Mamata Banerjee to submit an immediate report on post-poll violence that has erupted in Sandeshkhali. Sandehkhali, already troubled by unrest, experienced another round of clashes between women and the police on Sunday.

Article Title: 1993 Bombay blasts convict beaten to death in Kolhapur jail
Article Text:
Bombay blast

convict

beaten to death in

Kolhapur jail

a Tiger Memon associate

Kalamba jail known for poor safety

KOLHAPUR: Five inmates of Kolhapur’s Kalamba Central Jail attacked and killed another 59-year-old inmate convicted in the 1993 Bombay serial blasts case on Sunday morning.Munna — whose known aliases included Mohammad Alikhan and Manojkumar Bhawarlal Gupta — was beaten up with the concrete and metal cover of the drainage chamber near the prison ’s bathing well at 7.55am.CBI had registered a case against Munna at STF police station in Mumbai under the Terrorist and Disruptive Activities (Prevention) Act. He was brought to the Kalamba Central Jail in 2013. Before that, he was lodged in Mumbai’s Arthur Road Jail.The attackers have been identified as Bablu (alias Sandip Shankar Chavan), Pratik (alias Pilya Suresh Patil), Ruturaj (alias Degya Vinayak Inamdar), Sourabh Vikas Sidh and Dipak Netaji Khot. While Bablu, Pratik and Ruturaj have been arrested under the Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act (MCOCA), Sourabh and Dipak are in judicial custody. On Sunday morning, the five men approached Munna, who had come to the bathing well, and attacked him. Munna suffered deep cuts and started bleeding profusely. One prison worker tried to intervene, but he was also attacked.Swati Sathe, the deputy inspector general (prisons) said: “We are yet to ascertain the motive behind the attack, but the safety of the inmates is our prime concern. There are four convicts of the Bombay serial blast case currently lodged in the Kalamba. For their safety, we will separate them from the regular inmates. If required, we will shift them to other prisons. We will also increase CCTV coverage in the prison.”A case under IPC sections 302 (murder), 353 (assault on public servant), 323 (causing hurt voluntarily), 143 (unlawful assembly), 147 (rioting), 148 (armed rioting), 149 (common object to commit offence) has been registered against the five attackers at the Juna Rajwada police station.The primary investigation has revealed that some animosity had been brewing between the attackers and the deceased for along time.Sanjeevkumar Zade, the inspector of the Juna Rajwada police station, told TOI: “We are going to seek permission from the court to get the attackers’ custody. The motive behind the murder can be known after an investigation.”The Kalamba Central Jail has been mired in controversies over the past couple of years. The authorities have recovered banned narcotic substances such as ganja, mobile phones and SIM cards from inside the prison. Recently, more than 200 cellphones were reco vered from the jail. Amitabh Gupta, director-general (prisons), had dismissed 11 staffers, including two officials, for neglecting safety in the prison.Munna was a habitual absconder and a criminal who had escorted Tiger Memon, the prime accused in the serial blasts, in a four-wheeler from Mumbai to Raigad for the Shekhadi landing of a huge cache of arms, ammunition, hand grenades and RDX before the 1993 blasts. He also helped in its transportation back to Mumbai. He had completed his original 14-year sentence and was out of prison since 2007, when the SC enhanced it to a life term.
Article Summary: Five inmates of Kolhapur’s Kalamba Central Jail attacked and killed another 59-year-old inmate convicted in the 1993 Bombay serial blasts case on Sunday morning. Munna — whose known aliases included Mohammad Alikhan and Manojkumar Bhawarlal Gupta — was beaten up with the concrete and metal cover of the drainage chamber near the prison ’s bathing well.

Article Title: 13 killed, 15 injured as tractor-trolley carrying wedding guests overturns in Madhya Pradesh
Article Text: NEW DELHI: At least 13 people, including five children , were killed and 15 critically injured after a tractor-trolley bringing a marriage procession from bordering Rajasthan overturned in Madhya Pradesh 's Rajgarh district late Sunday night.The accident occurred around 9 pm near Piplodi in Rajgarh district, which is 150 km north of Bhopal and barely 2 km from Rajasthan.The wedding guests were heading from Rajasthan's Motipura village to Piplodi, with around 30 of them packed into the tractor-trolley, while some were on motorcycles. Near Piplodi, the tractor went out of control and overturned, crushing several people.Other wedding guests and locals began rescuing the trapped before local police joined the effort."So far, we have information regarding 13 deaths. Around 15 people were injured. Two of the more seriously injured ones have been referred to Bhopal for treatment. The rest are at Rajgarh district hospital," collector Harsh Dixit told TOI.The injured are not in a condition to speak, said Dixit. All the victims are from Rajasthan, he said.Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav has expressed his deepest condolences and said that the state government is in constant touch with the Rajasthan government."The news of the untimely death of 13 people from the Jhalawar district of Rajasthan due to the overturning of a tractor-trolley on Piplodi Road in Rajgarh district is extremely sad. Leader Narayan Singh Panwar along with the collector and SP Rajgarh are present on the spot. We are in touch with the Rajasthan government and Rajasthan police have also reached the spot," said CM Mohan Yadav on X."The treatment of the injured is going on in the district hospital, Rajgarh and some seriously injured patients have been referred to Bhopal...My deepest condolences are with the bereaved families. I pray for the speedy recovery of the injured," he added.President Droupadi Murmu also expressed her condolences to the families who lost their loved ones in the accident."The news of the death of many people in a road accident in Rajgarh district of Madhya Pradesh is very sad. I express my heartfelt condolences to the families who lost their loved ones and pray for the speedy recovery of the injured," wrote President Droupadi Murmu on X.
Article Summary: At least 13 people, including five children, were killed and 15 critically injured after a tractor-trolley overturned in Madhya Pradesh. The accident occurred around 9 pm near Piplodi in Rajgarh district, which is 150 km north of Bhopal and barely 2 km from Rajasthan.

Article Title: Killed tribal duo in self-defence: Banned Jharkhand Maoist outfit
Article Text: CHATRA : Days after the murders of a father-son duo from the particularly vulnerable tribal group ( PVTG ), Jharkhand's banned Naxal outfit Tritiya Sammelan Prastuti Committee (TSPC) claimed on Saturday that they killed the duo in self-defence when their cadres had gone to resolve an issue with the victims.Pankaj Birhor and his father Bifan were killed on May 25 at their home in Hindiyakala village in Chatra district.Pankaj's brother, Vidya Birhor , said the two were killed as they not only opposed the rebels' demand for extortion but had also handed over Mantu Ganjhu, a notorious extremist, to the police on April 15.However, the self-styled platoon commander, Ajay of TSPC's Chatra-Palamu Frontier Zonal Committee, said his squad had gone to resolve a dispute with Pankaj when it took a violent turn."Pankaj and his father were involved in an illegal liquor business in the area. Pankaj's brother Vidya was acting as a police informer and harassing local people," Ajay claimed.
Article Summary: Pankaj Birhor and his father Bifan were killed on May 25 at their home in Hindiyakala village in Chatra district. Tritiya Sammelan Prastuti Committee (TSPC) claimed on Saturday that they killed the duo in self-defence when their cadres had gone to resolve an issue with the victims.

Article Title: Emergency landing in Mumbai after threat note on Vistara flight
Article Text: NEW DELHI: A Vistara flight from Paris with 306 people on board received a bomb scare that had the pilots carry out an emergency landing at Mumbai airport on Sunday. This was the third bomb scare in the country in less than a week and the second such incident in Mumbai in two days.A handwritten note on an airsickness bag threatening a bomb was reported by Vistara. A full-scale emergency was declared at 10.08am and the flight landed safely at 10.19am. Fire tenders and ambulances were on standby when the Boeing 787 aircraft landed. It was taken to an isolated bay for security check. No bomb was found.“We confirm that a security concern has been noted by our staff while onboard Vistara flight UK024 operating from Paris to Mumbai,” said a Vistara spokesperson. “Following protocol, we immediately informed relevant authorities. The flight landed at Mumbai airport and we are fully cooperating with security agencies for all mandatory checks.”On Saturday, an IndiGo flight from Chennai to Mumbai received a bomb threat , which led to an emergency landing in Mumbai. The flight left Chennai around 6.50am and was en route when the bomb alert was received. “An unclaimed remote was found on board,” said a source.On May 28, an IndiGo flight from Delhi to Varanasi with 176 passengers on board received a bomb threat, following which the pilots ordered an emergency evacuation.
Article Summary: A handwritten note on an airsickness bag threatening a bomb was reported by Vistara. A full-scale emergency was declared and the flight landed safely at 10.19am. Fire tenders and ambulances were on standby when the Boeing 787 aircraft landed.

Article Title: 2 dead, 16 injured as bus overturns in Jammu's Akhnoor; second bus accident in the region
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Two people were killed and 16 others were injured when a bus overturned near Kaleeth village in the Akhnoor sub-division of Jammu on Sunday evening, according to police reports. The accident occurred when the driver lost control of the vehicle.Police identified the deceased as Kewal Kumar and V Bhagat, who died at the scene. The injured passengers were transported to a nearby hospital for treatment, with three of them later being referred to Government Medical College Hospital for specialized care.This marks the second major accident in the Akhnoor area within a span of four days. On May 30, a bus carrying pilgrims plunged into a 150-foot gorge at Tungi-Morh, resulting in the loss of 22 lives and injuries to 57 others.(With agency inputs)
Article Summary: A bus overturned near Kaleeth village in the Akhnoor sub-division of Jammu. Police identified the deceased as Kewal Kumar and V Bhagat, who died at the scene. The injured passengers were transported to a nearby hospital for treatment, with three of them later being referred to Government Medical College Hospital.

Article Title: Constable shoots son dead over money at EVM store room
Article Text: VIJAYAWADA: A policeman fatally shot his son in a fit of rage over a request for money. The incident took place on Saturday night at an EVM storeroom in Ongole town of Prakasam districtAn armed reserve constable hailing from Tripurantakam village was assigned guard duty at the warehouse storing EVMs . He arrived at the warehouse around 10 pm on a two-wheeler, accompanied by his son, despite regulations permitting only on-duty personnel inside the premises.According to police, Kodamala Prasad Babu, a 52-year-old constable, was deputed for guard duty at the EVM and VVPAT reserve godown at Bhagyanagar 4th line in Ongole. On Saturday night, his son Kodamala Seshu Kamal (20) brought his father to duty on his bike from Srinivasa Colony 1st Line, Ongole. During this time, Seshu Kamal requested money from his father for family needs, as Prasad Babu had withdrawn his monthly salary from the ATM. However, Prasad Babu refused to provide the funds.An argument ensued between Prasad Babu and his son regarding the need for money. It is reported that Prasad Babu was in an inebriated state during the quarrel. In a moment of rage, Prasad Babu entered the nearby guard room, retrieved his service rifle, and shot his son, who was standing on the road, at around 10:05 pm. Even after the initial shot, Prasad Babu cocked the weapon, indicating his intention to fire again. The four constables on duty intervened, disarming Prasad Babu and preventing any further escalation of the incident.The injured Seshu Kamal was rushed to Ongole RIMS hospital for treatment by the other constables. However, upon examination, the doctor confirmed that he was brought dead. A case has been registered, and investigation is underway.Prasad Babu has been arrested and remanded in custody.Police added that the incident took place at a reserve godown, nine kilometres from the counting centre EVM strong room at RISE College, and no polled EVMs or postal ballot boxes were present at the location.
